text.p: MagneTek Inc said Friday it had received enough tenders and consents from holders of its 10-3/4 percent senior subordinated debentures due 1998 to amend the related indenture to remove restrictive covenants.
On May 29 MagneTek announced an offer to repurchase the debentures.

It said those who properly tendered their debentures and delivered their consents by 1700 EST June 11 will be entitled to receive a consent payment of $15 per $1,000 principal amount of debentures, plus a price based on a yield of 50 basis points over the reference treasury security.
Those who tender late will receive the same minus $15 per debenture, it said.
MagneTek manufactures integrated electrical products, including electric motors, generators and variable-speed drives, power supplies and lighting products.
